content.description: Algorithm complexity (2017 Spring, Final, Question 11 b)

p.line: Consider the problem of trying to find out which student has the largest student ID number (SID) in a class of N students, with N a power of two (2, 4, 8, 16, â€¦). Note that all SIDs are unique.
What is the worst-case running time and the worst-case number of SID comparisons, for the algorithm listed below?

Algorithm II: All students stand up, pair up, and simultaneously compare SIDs, and the smaller of each pair sits down. Those still standing repeat the process, pairing up with another standing person, until there is only one left standing; that student has the largest SID.
May never end, could go forever

content.hint: The comparisons are done simultaneously in parallel.
